Cheesies.des: Grilled cheese joint.  The perfect late night food.  Greasy as can be.

Trader Todds.des: Tiki theme karoke bar.  It's good if you like this sort of thing.

Room 13.des: Speakeasy themed bar.  Hole in the wall.  Often has a live musical act. Amazing cocktails.  Need a reservation / referral.  Email luke@oldchicagoinn.com ahead of time if you want to drop by

CBA.des: Bagel sandwiches to cure even the most persistent hangover.

Sheffields bar.des: Just a great neighborhood bar.  Excellent beer selection

Dimos pizza.des: Pizza joint with creative toppings.  Chicken parm is my fav

Tango Sur.des: Argentinean steak house.  Incredible value.  BYOB.  Great for a date!

Music Box Theater.des: Films that aren't quite the mainstream in a cool setting.  Great for a date!

Schoolyard.des: Dive bar with a good patio.

Schubas.des: Cheap live music, often sells out, check their calendar regularly!

Beermiscuous.des: Beer bar.  Incredible selection.  It's almost a coffee shop, but with beer?  Place to hang, bring a board game or cards.

Rotofugi.des: Off the wall shop. Fun to wander around here while you're waiting for your table at Batter and Berries.

Batter & Berries.des: Great brunch, go for chicken & waffles and french toast flight

Prost.des: German style beer hall.  They sell boots.  Fun place to start a night

Kingston Mines.des: Legendary blues temple. Student discount is great

Burwood Tap.des: Quintessential neighborhood bar.  My favorite in the city

Del Seoul.des: Korean Mexican fusion.  Shrimp tacos are to die for

Weiner Circle.des: Famous for how terrible the staff treats you.  (In)decent milkshakes.

Chilam Balam.des: Mexican small plates.  A little pricey, but so so good.

Dryhop brewers.des: Great brews and good food to boot.

Collectivo Coffee.des: Favorite spot for breakfast / casual brunch.  Breakfast burritos are excellent.  Used to like to do work here.

Galway Arms.des: Classic pub.  Great for soccer games.

Ovengrinder Pizza Co.des: Pizza joint.  Terribly touristy, waittimes are extreme, but pretty great; you should probably go once.

Athenian Room.des: Casual greek.  Been around for decades, my parents used to eat here when they were in their 20s.

Café Ba-Ba-Reeba.des: Spanish tapas.  Good date spot.  Lettuce-entertain-you

Twin Anchors.des: Rib joint.  Get em with the zesty sauce.  Been around for decades, my parents used to eat here when they were in their 20s.

The Hangge-Uppe.des: The Hangge-Uppe.  No one tries to go here, but then they do

Happy Village.des: Dive bar with cheap cocktails that you can bring food to.  Great vibes and they have pool tables

Big Star.des: Taco joint in Wicker park.  Great patio

Piece Pizza.des: Local thin crust pizza joint.  Live band karoke occassionally

Whirlyball.des: Bumper cars combined with lacrosse.  You should do this at least once before you leave Chicago

Paulie Gee's.des: NYC pizza that's pretty damn good.  Nice place to start a bar crawl in Logan Square.

The Owl.des: I never feel like I'm cool enough to be here, but I typically enjoy myself.  Cocktail bar.

Dos Urban Café.des: Upscale mexican food that is quite tasty.

Arami.des: My favorite sushi spot in the city

Hopleaf.des: Andersonville mainstay.  Great beer selection and excellent mussels.

Greek Islands.des: Flaming cheese!!  Touristy, but you should go once

Lagunitas Brewing.des: Great tap room and a cool tour

Cho Sun Ok.des: Korean BBQ.  Delicious.  Long lines.  Cheap.  The staff will probably be rude to you, but it's worth it.  If you have a Korean friend, have them take you here.  BYOB, get beer from Half Acre up the street.

Half Acre Tap Room.des: Chicago brewer. Love their stuff!  Awesome tour on Saturday mornings…

El Asadero.des: Steak burritos are dopeee.  Old school and unassuming, but quite good.

Half Acre Brew House.des: Quieter than their Lincoln taproom, sometimes has small batch stuff unavailable elsewhere

Spiteful taproom.des: Fun to go here after Half Acre

Pizzeria Bebu.des: Dude this place is so good.  Thin crust pizza.  Call and order take out, pick it up and take it over to the mousetrap across the street.

Sully's.des: Best wings in the city!!  But it's a dive bar.

Big and Little's.des: Casual spot for tacos and po'boys.

Valois Restaurant.des: Old school cafeteria style restaurant.  Casual.  Apparently an Obama fav?

Medici.des: Hyde park pizza spot. Obama favorite?

Nella Pizza.des: On-campus italian / pizza spot.  Super good!

MingHin.des: Great for dim sum.  There's also one like right next to our Marianos, but I think this one is better.

Portillos.des: Chicagoland mainstay.  America at its best and worst.  You should go once before you leave.

Oiistar Ramen.des: Favorite ramen place in the city.

Ceres Café.des: Their mixed drinks are…  extreme.  This is where traders would go after the close when the pits were a thing.

Gus' World Famous Fried Chicken.des: I worry this place gets overlooked amongst its flashier Fulton nieghbors.  It’s so good.

Pilot Project.des: Brewery incubator with a great patio.

Taqueria Los Comales.des: For me, its chief appeal is that it's next to pilot project.  Tasty, cheap tacos!

Middlebrow.des: Hip brewery.  It's not highbrow, it's not lowbrow, it's….

Quiote.des: Upscale mexican food that is quite tasty.

Longman and Eagle.des: Weird food, but it's super good.

Giant.des: Awesome american bistro.  Get a res

Bang Bang Pie and Biscuits.des: They make pie and biscuits that are really good.
